Description: Marl pottery vase with flat base, moderate shoulder, inset neck, and roll over rim, coated with red slip and streak burnished with vertical strokes. Incised potmarks on opposite sides of body: one is box-shaped, the other is a cross, applied after firing.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 24 pl. xxxii.40k (showing only one potmark). Like Polished red P46J in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked on base H120
Condition: good, slip worn at rim and base.
